trans-unit.source: Applies To: Windows PowerShell 4.0, Windows PowerShell 5.0
trans-unit.target: Applies To: Windows PowerShell 4.0, Windows PowerShell 5.0

trans-unit.source: The User resource in Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC) provides a mechanism to manage local user accounts on the target node.
trans-unit.target: The User resource in Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC) provides a mechanism to manage local user accounts on the target node.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the account name for which you want to ensure a specific state.
trans-unit.target: Indicates the account name for which you want to ensure a specific state.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the description you want to use for the user account.
trans-unit.target: Indicates the description you want to use for the user account.

trans-unit.source: Indicates if the account is enabled.
trans-unit.target: Indicates if the account is enabled.

trans-unit.source: Set this property to $true to ensure that this account is disabled, and set it to $false to ensure that it is enabled.
trans-unit.target: Set this property to $true to ensure that this account is disabled, and set it to $false to ensure that it is enabled.

trans-unit.source: Set this property to "Present" to ensure that the account exists, and set it to "Absent" to ensure that the account does not exist.
trans-unit.target: Set this property to "Present" to ensure that the account exists, and set it to "Absent" to ensure that the account does not exist.

trans-unit.source: Represents a string with the full name you want to use for the user account.
trans-unit.target: Represents a string with the full name you want to use for the user account.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the password you want to use for this account.
trans-unit.target: Indicates the password you want to use for this account.

trans-unit.source: Indicates if the user can change the password.
trans-unit.target: Indicates if the user can change the password.

trans-unit.source: Set this property to $true to ensure that the user cannot change the password, and set it to $false to allow the user to change the password.
trans-unit.target: Set this property to $true to ensure that the user cannot change the password, and set it to $false to allow the user to change the password.

trans-unit.source: Indicates if the user must change the password at the next sign in.
trans-unit.target: Indicates if the user must change the password at the next sign in.

trans-unit.source: Set this property to $true if the user must change the password.
trans-unit.target: Set this property to $true if the user must change the password.

trans-unit.source: Indicates if the password will expire.
trans-unit.target: Indicates if the password will expire.

trans-unit.source: To ensure that the password for this account will never expire, set this property to $true, and set it to $false if the password will expire.
trans-unit.target: To ensure that the password for this account will never expire, set this property to $true, and set it to $false if the password will expire.

trans-unit.source: Indicates that the configuration of another resource must run before this resource is configured.
trans-unit.target: Indicates that the configuration of another resource must run before this resource is configured.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the ID of the resource configuration script block that you want to run first is ResourceName and its type is ResourceType, the syntax for using this property is DependsOn = "[ResourceType]ResourceName".
trans-unit.target: For example, if the ID of the resource configuration script block that you want to run first is ResourceName and its type is ResourceType, the syntax for using this property is DependsOn = "[ResourceType]ResourceName".
